04_01: EJS stands for Embedded JavaScript, a templating language for server-rendered HTML.
04_02: The <%= %> syntax in EJS is used to output the value of a variable.
04_03: The <% %> tag lets you run JavaScript code in EJS without outputting anything.
04_04: EJS template files usually end with the .ejs extension.
04_05: You can’t include Bootstrap by linking to a .ejs file—Bootstrap is included via CDN or downloading CSS/JS files.
04_06: btn-primary is the Bootstrap class for a primary-colored button.
04_07: The <link> tag is used to link CSS files in HTML documents.
04_08: The col-12 class makes a Bootstrap column span the full width of its parent.
04_09: In EJS, <%= users[0] %> outputs the first item of the users array.
04_10: document.getElementById('main') selects an element by its ID in vanilla JavaScript.
04_11: querySelectorAll() returns a NodeList of elements matching the selector.
04_13: Use textContent to change the text of an element with vanilla JS.
04_14: $('button').on('click', ... ) attaches a click handler with jQuery.
04_15: .addClass() adds a CSS class to the selected elements in jQuery.
04_16: fetch() is the modern way to get data from APIs in JavaScript.
04_17: <%= name %> outputs the value of the JavaScript variable name in EJS.
04_18: The row class in Bootstrap is used to create a horizontal group of columns.
04_19: JSON.parse() turns a JSON string into a JavaScript object.
04_20: The defer attribute tells the browser to run the script after the page has loaded.
04_22: The src attribute specifies the source JavaScript file in a <script> tag.
04_23: innerHTML gets or sets the HTML content of an element in vanilla JS.
04_24: AJAX lets web pages send and receive data from a server asynchronously.
04_25: $('.active') gets elements with the class active in jQuery.
04_26: The submit event occurs when a form is submitted.
04_27: <% include partial.ejs %> includes a partial template in EJS.
04_28: To send JSON with fetch(), you set the body and Content-Type header appropriately.
04_29: text-center centers text horizontally in Bootstrap.
04_30: .val() gets or sets the value of input fields in jQuery.
04_31: navbar is the Bootstrap class for a responsive navigation bar.
04_32: $('div p') selects all <p> elements inside a <div> using jQuery.
04_33: .remove() deletes elements from the DOM in jQuery.
04_34: .css() gets or sets CSS properties for elements in jQuery.
04_35: id is the attribute for unique identification of HTML elements.
04_36: The Bootstrap grid system arranges content in rows and columns.
04_37: p-3 adds padding to an element in Bootstrap.
04_38: Use element.style.backgroundColor to change an element’s background color with vanilla JS.
04_39: $(document).ready(...) runs code when the DOM has finished loading in jQuery.
04_40: href is the attribute used in <link> tags to specify the CSS file path.
